column4: how would i copy all contents in file to clipboard?  with terminal
ie,  copything /etc/apache2/apache2.conf
then i can just paste wherever i want
doubt it's possible!  there are like 3 running clipboards in linux!
thanks  :)
using the middle mouse key is a common example for #2 - try by highlighting text in terminal then (most likely) clicking your mouse wheel (it's separate from gnome) - i forget the third
good to know
good question.  not that i personally know of, but hoping someone has an answer for you.  good luck man.
sounds like something someone can write pretty easily
well considering vimtutor is just a text file opened in vim - i'd say yes ;)
heh.... you know what i mean
FYI it's "ps aux" if you look at the top of your "ps -aux" you will see an error about the "-"
i used to use -aux all the time until someone pointed it out to me
noted
it's logical  to use  -     as it is in most things
perhaps i should reconsider :)  it's all i ever tried really

sounds like it's is logging into the xterm option instead of gnome - something that is selected after you click your username at the GDM screen, session at the bottom - be sure it is set to ubuntu-desktop
i have no such option, at login it only lets me enter a username and pwd, doesn't default anymore
for that i have no idea - good luck man.
thx anyway
you could try "eject /dev/cdrom" and replace cdrom with the various options
